results.title: Twelve angry men = 12 angry men
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Reginald Rose, Henry Fonda and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A tense and brilliantly directed drama focusing on twelve men in a jury who are considering a verdict on a case of a young Puerto Rican youth charged with murder. Henry Fonda plays the impassioned man of reason, not convinced of the guilt of the accused and battling against his eleven co-jurors who all want to convict the teenager and leave the hot and sweaty jury room. The film is famous for its condemnation of capital punishment. Also stars Lee J. Cobb, Jack Warden and Jack Klugman.

results.title: Twelfth night: or what you will [Nunn]
results.creator_credit: Trevor Nunn, David Parfitt, Stephen Evans, Twelfth Night Productions and Fine Line Features
results.brief_description: Trevor Nunn’s faithful adaptation of Shakespeare’s tale of love, deception and gender stars Ben Kingley, Helena Bonham Carter, Nigel Hawthorn, Richard E Grant, Imogen Stubbs, Mel Smith, Imelda Staunton and Toby Stephens. A brother and sister are separated in a shipwreck and land on the shore of Illyria. The sister Viola (Stubbs) disguises herself as a man and takes service with Duke Orsino (Stephens) who has fallen passionately in love with Lady Olivia (Bonham Carter). Viola is entrusted to plead on her master’s behalf and finds that Olivia has fallen madly in love with her. Thus begins the comedy of deception which has delighted audiences for centuries.

results.title: Twelfth night: or what you will
results.brief_description: This is the Renaissance Theatre Company’s production of the play directed by Kenneth Branagh. The cast is led by Richard Briers as Malvolio and Caroline Langrishe as Viola. A brother and sister are separated in a shipwreck and land on the shore of Illyria. The sister Viola disguises herself as a man and takes service with Duke Orsino who has fallen passionately in love with Lady Olivia. Viola is entrusted to plead on her master’s behalf and finds that Olivia has fallen madly in love with her. Thus begins the comedy of deception which has delighted audiences for centuries.

results.title: Twelfth night: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Peter Seabourne, John Seabourne, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids, Anvil Film and Recording Group and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description: Shows extracts from various scenes of Shakespeare’s “Twelfth night” accompanied by Sir Tyrone Guthrie discussing the production of the play and the problems presented by scenery.

results.title: Tweekage
results.brief_description: Skateboard enthusiasts will enjoy this hour of footage recording some of Australia’s top skaters performing impressive moves; kick flipping, sliding and grinding across Sydney, Melbourne, the Gold Coast and major skating events. For those of you who don’t skate you may be inspired to give it a try, although the SLAM section illustrates that even professionals are prone to hurting themselves. Good camera work puts the viewer right into the heart of the action and provides an adrenaline rush.

results.title: TVA = Tennessee Valley Authority
results.brief_description: An impersonal survey of the dams built, the irrigation, navigation, and industrial advantages accruing to the people of the Tennessee Valley as a result of this, and the advances made by both agriculture and industry, and social services, since the inception of the Tennessee Valley Authority’s scheme.

results.title: TV: the anonymous teacher
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey C. Weber, Episcopal Church, Media Action Research Center and United Methodist Communications
results.brief_description: Television is more than entertainment, it always “teaches” children and adults. Experts are interviewed to try and find out the effect of television on children. Broadcasters seem to see TV purely as a sales agent, and children grow up to grade three, implicitly believing all the advertisements as well as everything else they see. Deals with the impact of violence, racial and sexual stereotyping, commercials, and postitive and negative values in programming. Offers some suggestions for television programs as well as suggesting action for change. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
